title: Fermat’s Last Stand: Game Rosters
summary:
Key ideas:
- The author has sorted people into three groups to participate in a game
- Each group has a designated DM to coordinate with
- There are also meatspace groups operating under falenas108 and gyukuro

Key learnings:
- Sorting people into groups based on time zone, friendship, and belief diversity can be helpful for coordination
- Having designated coordinators (DMs) can help ensure smooth communication and organization

Key questions:
- Who is participating in the game?
- What are the specific rules and objectives of the game?
- How will the author and DMs ensure that everyone involved is on the same page and able to communicate effectively?
